messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On November 11, DET. J. K. Simmons was alerted to a string of burglaries in the Lakeside neighborhood. Principal informants were Mr. Carter, a homeowner, and Ms. Wallace, a local business owner. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. L. M. Nelson - OPERATIONS Det. Simmons, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective N. O. Price and Detective P. Q. Russell joined the inquiry. GREEN 17:10 Burglaries Mr. Carter's electronics were stolen, while Ms. Wallace reported cash missing from her store's register. Forensic. Technician Victor gathered fingerprints from both scenes. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Simmons Sr, Det. Price, Det. Russell OPERATIONS Lt. Nelson INFORMANT Wallace, Diane 25 Elm Street, Lakeside, Maine 189-810. 93975. GREEN 17:10 Burglaries By 7:40 PM, Detectives Simmons, Price, and Russell, supervised by Lieutenant Nelson, identified a potential suspect from a local CCTV feed. Captain R. S. Taylor initiated a city-wide search. Sergeant T. U. Vincent and Sergeant V. W. York collaborated with neighboring precincts. By 9:15 PM, a suspect was taken into custody. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Simmons Sr, Det. Price, Det. Russell OPERATIONS Lt. Nelson AFFIDAVIT - Burglaries Report 1) List of Stolen Items 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Security Footage 5) Nearby Traffic Cams (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE G. Adams L.N.P.D. 28.110 P66 3075 Carter, BRIAN NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 170-3375 DETECTIVE: J. SIMMONS ITEM: 66-5350- 105 CRIME: 17:10 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 83880 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 5/05/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. J. K. Simmons  Officer Context: On November 11, DET. J. K. Simmons was alerted to a string of burglaries in the Lakeside neighborhood. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. L. M. Nelson  Officer Context: Lt. L. M. Nelson - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective N. O. Price  Officer Context: Detective N. O. Price and Detective P. Q. Russell joined the inquiry. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective P. Q. Russell  Officer Context: Detective N. O. Price and Detective P. Q. Russell joined the inquiry. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Victor  Officer Context: Forensic. Technician Victor gathered fingerprints from both scenes. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Simmons  Officer Context: By 7:40 PM, Detectives Simmons, Price, and Russell, supervised by Lieutenant Nelson, identified a potential suspect. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Price  Officer Context: By 7:40 PM, Detectives Simmons, Price, and Russell, supervised by Lieutenant Nelson, identified a potential suspect. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Russell  Officer Context: By 7:40 PM, Detectives Simmons, Price, and Russell, supervised by Lieutenant Nelson, identified a potential suspect. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain R. S. Taylor  Officer Context: Captain R. S. Taylor initiated a city-wide search. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant T. U. Vincent  Officer Context: Sergeant T. U. Vincent and Sergeant V. W. York collaborated with neighboring precincts. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant V. W. York Officer Context: Sergeant T. U. Vincent and Sergeant V. W. York collaborated with neighboring precincts. Officer Role: Sergeant
